Thanks -jonny- ;) Is there anyway to automaticly start movie in English audio or do i have to switch it every time in English when i start the movie? I'm using The KMPlayer.
You can remove audio tracks with mkvmerge

If you are using VLC. A free program that plays just about everything so I don't know why you would not want to use it. Just right click and you can change it to English and remove the subtitles with a few easy clicks.

Under Audio
>Audio track
>>DTS, 6ch 1536kbps [English] 

Under Video
>Subtitles Track
>>Disable

VYCanisMajoris is right.
VLC plays (almost) everything. Its free, open-source, lightweight.. its brilliant. Never had any issues with it. And no coded packs needed. So you're other programs don't get messed up.

Just be careful when you install: select the correct filetypes you want VLC to play. Eg: I selected all video files for VLC. So I can still play all audio with WMP or whatever program you prefer for audio.

Oh, and VLC exists for Windows, MAc and Linux.
